results.title: Snowdonia
results.creator_credit: Horace Shepherd, Inspiration Pictures (GB), British Council and Idloes Owen
results.brief_description: Some of the loveliest scenery in Wales; the view from the summit of Snowden, historic Conway Castel, the Swallow Falls. Shots of Caeruaroon Castle include the Kings Gate, the ruined Banqueting Hall and the Eagle Tower where the Welsh flag and the Union Jack fly side by side.

results.title: Snowdonia
results.creator_credit: Julia Spark, Granada Television International and Richard Guinea
results.brief_description: Combines ground and serial photography with diagrams to explain the formation of glacial features which characterize the landscape of Snowdonia National Park in northwestern Wales. Shows the results of slate mining and discusses conflict between preservation and electrical development and tourism.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Julia Spark, Granada Television International and Richard Guinea

results.title: Snowdon on camera. Parts 1 and 2
results.creator_credit: Iain Johnstone and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Lord Snowden, a well known photographer examines varying techniques and discusses the work of two photographers who have influenced him. He emphasises the importance of the eye rather than the camera and challenges the claim that photography requires complicated equipment and lighting. He also discusses the value of photographs to different people.
results.description: Lord Snowden, a well known photographer examines varying techniques and discusses the work of two photographers who have influenced him. results.title: Snowbound
results.creator_credit: Linda Gottlieb, Learning Corporation of America and Robert Young
results.brief_description: A shortened version of the motion picture “Snowbound”. Features two teenagers who learn to understand themselves and each other when they are caught in a desolate area during a snow storm. Written by Edward Pomerantz and Kurt Villadsen from the book by Harry Mazer.

results.title: Snowbirds
results.creator_credit: Nimbus Film Productions, ONF | NFB and Michael Brun
results.brief_description: From cockpit to ground to sky, the camera follows the spectacular aerobatics of the Canadian Forces Air Demonstration team who control their 9.7 m long, single-engine jets as if they were extensions of their own bodies. During practice sessions, their maneuvers are videotaped for the pilots’ viewing and subsequent correction. Narrated by Alan Bleviss.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Nimbus Film Productions, ONF | NFB and Michael Brun

results.title: Snow, sand and savages: the life of Frank Hurley
results.creator_credit: Anthony Buckley Productions and Anthony Buckley
results.brief_description: This is a portrait of Frank Hurley - pioneer cameraman, war photographer, explorer, film director, writer, lecturer, broadcaster and Australia’s best known stills photographer. ‘Snow, sand and savages’ pays tribute to Hurley’s life and work and covers his first trip to Antarctica with Mawson and Shackleton, his 1919 footage of the Ross and Keith Smith flight from London to Australia, his 1920’s expeditions to New Guinea, and his coverage of both world wars. Some light relief is included with an excerpt from Hurley’s foray into feature films with ‘The Jungle woman’ in 1926. Narrated by Leo McKern and written by Joan Long.
results.title_for_label: Snow, sand and savages: the life of Frank Hurley

Some light relief is included with an excerpt from Hurley’s foray into feature films with ‘The Jungle woman’ in 1926. Narrated by Leo McKern and written by Joan Long.

results.title: Snow White and the seven dwarfs [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney, Walt Disney Productions and David D. Hand
results.brief_description: This film is regarded as a milestone in filmmaking as Walt Disney’s first full-length animated feature. Adapted from Grimm’s Fairy Tales, the film is the fairytale of Snow White, the beautiful princess whose life is threatened by the jealous Queen. Snow White finds safe haven with the seven dwarfs: Doc, Happy, Grumpy, Sleepy, Sneezy, Bashful and Dopey until a mysterious old woman arrives with a poison apple. Three years in the making, this feature propagated new developments in animation, using an unprecedented amount of man-hours in the creation of realistic movement on screen. This film is imbued in bountiful humour and music and of course striking animation. Originally billed as a children’s film, “Snow White and the seven dwarfs” is a film that from the outset had the ability to appeal across age brackets.

results.title: Snow thrills
results.creator_credit: Eugene W. Castle and Castle Films
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: ice skating from coast to coast; ice yachts; Siberian sled dogs race; polar bears; ski thrills; cross-country skiing in Canada; longest bob-sled takes kids to town; bob-sledding at 60 miles per hour.
